label: phenotype
description: A (combination of) quality(ies) of an organism determined by the interaction of its genetic make-up and environment that differentiates specific instances of a species from other instances of the same species.

label: GC content
description: The percentage of guanine and cytosine nucleotides in DNA

label: respiration
description: An organism's observable and characteristic method of performing cellular respiration, distinguished primarily by the specific terminal electron acceptor its metabolic pathways utilize for the purpose of producing cellular energy.

label: pH tolerance
description: The ability of an organism to survive exposure to pH values outside its optimal growth range

label: temperature optimum (metabolic activity)
description: The specific temperature at which a microorganism exhibits maximum metabolic activity and growth rate within its viable range.

label: NaCl optimum
description: The specific concentration of sodium chloride at which a microorganism exhibits maximum growth rate and metabolic efficiency.

label: pH optimum (growth range)
description: The specific pH at which an organism exhibits maximum growth rate

label: culture temperature observation
description: An observation specializing temperature observation for culture temperature data (e.g., reported culture conditions).

label: pH range (cellular homeostasis)
description: The span of hydrogen ion concentrations within which a microorganism can maintain cellular homeostasis and sustain growth.

label: temperature optimum (growth range)
description: The specific temperature at which an organism exhibits maximum growth rate

label: microbe
description: An organism or virus or viron that is too small to be viewed by the unaided eye.
comment: METPO is primarily concerned with unicellular, prokaryotic life forms, i.e. bacteria and archea, including the cases of giant bacteria like Thiomargarita

label: material entity
description: An object or portion of a substance or mixture of substances that consists of matter
